snippet: Two sons of passengers on Flight 370 have chosen different ways to cope: One holds vigil with other passengers’ relatives, while the other is assuming the worst.
abstract: Some relatives of passengers on missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, most of whom are Chinese, hope their relatives are alive, while others assume the worst; Steve Wang and Wang Le, who both had mothers on Flight 370, show the divergence in the way family members are coping, as one spends time with other passengers' relatives in Beijing while the other has gone back to living his life.
lead_paragraph: Two sons of passengers on Flight 370 have chosen different ways to cope: One holds vigil with other passengers’ relatives, while the other is assuming the worst.

headline.main: Lingering Hope vs. Onset of Grief Over Lost Flight
